This figure is intended to demonstrate the diversity of possible conceptualisations of 'neighbour' that are often deployed in spatial analysis contexts, and represent possible different approaches to relative space. 


::: {.cell hash='fig2-09-spatial-weights_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_a7126242f93cbb3ddb36ed9b73af8f2d'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(sf)
library(dplyr)
library(spdep)
library(sp)
```
:::


First read a polygons dataset. You'll need to supply your own for this.


::: {.cell hash='fig2-09-spatial-weights_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_b43e4b1165e2a2961e4cee7acfdc8bf0'}

```{.r .cell-code}
chch <- st_read("chch-sa2.gpkg") # you need a spatial dataset
```
:::


The [`spdep` package](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/spdep/index.html) I am using here requires the data in the `sp` package format, so convert to that. The best guidance on `spdep` I've found is in 

> Bivand R, EJ Pebesma, and V GÃ³mez-Rubio. 2013. _Applied Spatial Data Analysis with R_. 2nd edn. Springer.

and you will need guidance, because it's a tricky package to use. The newer [`sfdep` package](https://cran.r-project.org/package=sfdep) is still finding its feet at time of writing (Oct 2023).


::: {.cell hash='fig2-09-spatial-weights_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_c0256c9d30b2373c3568beb36816ec0a'}

```{.r .cell-code}
polys <- chch %>%
  select(geom) %>%
  as("Spatial")
```
:::


Now make some points inside the polygons, and also some centroids.


::: {.cell hash='fig2-09-spatial-weights_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_f703a3fc2cbe01eba7c91e9148735088'}

```{.r .cell-code}
pts <- chch %>%
  st_point_on_surface() %>%
  st_geometry()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning: st_point_on_surface assumes attributes are constant over geometries
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
pts_c <- chch %>%
  st_centroid() %>%
  st_geometry()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning: st_centroid assumes attributes are constant over geometries
```
:::
:::


These are presented in a single figure in the book in four rows of three, Here I show them as sets of three for greater clarity. Include the following plot setup code if you want to present them as in the book.


::: {.cell hash='fig2-09-spatial-weights_cache/html/eval-FALSE_2870a5a12400d3230108f041f25ebd69'}

```{.r .cell-code}
layout(matrix(1:12, ncol = 3, byrow = TRUE))
par(mai = rep(0, 4))
```
:::


And now work through a series of possible weights options.

## Contiguity based


::: {.cell fig.dim='[8,3]' hash='fig2-09-spatial-weights_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_ed1d29fc72f314e14695a702c2ff0812'}

```{.r .cell-code}
layout(matrix(1:3, ncol = 3, byrow = TRUE))
par(mai = c(0, 0, 0.15, 0))

nb <- polys %>% poly2nb(queen = TRUE)
plot(polys, col = "lightgrey", lwd = 0.5, border = 'white', 
     main = "Queen's rule adjacency")
plot(nb, pts, col = 'red', lwd = 0.5, add = TRUE)

nb <- polys %>% poly2nb(queen = FALSE)
plot(polys, col = "lightgrey", lwd = 0.5, border = 'white', 
     main = "Rook's rule adjacency")
plot(nb, pts, col = 'red', lwd = 0.5, add = TRUE)

nb <- nb %>% nblag(2) %>% nblag_cumul()
plot(polys, col = "lightgrey", lwd = 0.5, border = 'white', 
     main = "Cumulative lag-2 adjacency")
plot(nb, pts, col = 'red', lwd = 0.5, add = TRUE)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](fig2-09-spatial-weights_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=768}
:::
:::


## _k_-nearest neighbours
Note that we use the centroids to calculate the distances, but the points inside the polygons from `st_point_on_surface()` for the plotting.


::: {.cell fig.dim='[8,3]' hash='fig2-09-spatial-weights_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_37f492e32faba212a05bcd855bbb1824'}

```{.r .cell-code}
layout(matrix(1:3, ncol = 3, byrow = TRUE))
par(mai = c(0, 0, 0.15, 0))

nb <- pts_c %>% knearneigh(k = 3) %>% knn2nb()
plot(polys, col = "lightgrey", lwd = 0.5, border = 'white', 
     main = "k = 3")
plot(nb, pts, col = 'red', lwd = 0.5, add = TRUE)

nb <- pts_c %>% knearneigh(k = 6) %>% knn2nb()
plot(polys, col = "lightgrey", lwd = 0.5, border = 'white', 
     main = "k = 6")
plot(nb, pts, col = 'red', lwd = 0.5, add = TRUE)

nb <- pts_c %>% knearneigh(k = 12) %>% knn2nb()
plot(polys, col = "lightgrey", lwd = 0.5, border = 'white', 
     main = "k = 12")
plot(nb, pts, col = 'red', lwd = 0.5, add = TRUE)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](fig2-09-spatial-weights_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=768}
:::
:::


## Distance criteria
Next, distance criteria, again calculated from centroids, but visualised using the `st_point_on_surface()`.


::: {.cell fig.dim='[8,3]' hash='fig2-09-spatial-weights_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-7_7671e832aee29072d346b9ff7d128680'}

```{.r .cell-code}
layout(matrix(1:3, ncol = 3, byrow = TRUE))
par(mai = c(0, 0, 0.15, 0))

nb <- pts_c %>% dnearneigh(d1 = 0, d2 = 1000)
plot(polys, col = "lightgrey", lwd = 0.5, border = 'white', 
     main = "Distance < 1000")
plot(nb, pts, col = 'red', lwd = 0.5, add = TRUE)

nb <- pts_c %>% dnearneigh(d1 = 0, d2 = 1500)
plot(polys, col = "lightgrey", lwd = 0.5, border = 'white', 
     main = "Distance < 1500")
plot(nb, pts, col = 'red', lwd = 0.5, add = TRUE)

nb <- pts_c %>% dnearneigh(d1 = 1500, d2 = 2000)
plot(polys, col = "lightgrey", lwd = 0.5, border = 'white', 
     main = "1500 < Distance < 2000")
plot(nb, pts, col = 'red', lwd = 0.5, add = TRUE)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](fig2-09-spatial-weights_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=768}
:::
:::


## Graph-based approaches
Finally, some network-based possibilities, [Delaunay triangulation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Delaunay_triangulation), [Gabriel graph](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gabriel_graph) and the [relative neighbour graph](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Relative_neighborhood_graph).


::: {.cell fig.dim='[8,3]' hash='fig2-09-spatial-weights_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-8_06c1cb81efeec9a6d8109892d565b61f'}

```{.r .cell-code}
layout(matrix(1:3, ncol = 3, byrow = TRUE))
par(mai = c(0, 0, 0.15, 0))

g <- tri2nb(pts_c)
plot(polys, col = "lightgrey", lwd = 0.5, border = 'white', 
     main = "Delaunay triangulation")
plot(g, pts, col = 'red', lwd = 0.5, add = TRUE)

g <- gabrielneigh(pts_c)
nb <- graph2nb(g)
plot(polys, col = "lightgrey", lwd = 0.5, border = 'white', 
     main = "Gabriel graph")
plot(nb, pts, col = 'red', lwd = 0.5, add = TRUE)

g <- relativeneigh(pts_c)
nb <- graph2nb(g)
plot(polys, col = "lightgrey", lwd = 0.5, border = 'white', 
     main = "Relative neighbour graph")
plot(nb, pts, col = 'red', lwd = 0.5, add = TRUE)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](fig2-09-spatial-weights_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=768}
:::
:::
